III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Approximately a week ago, one of the facility supervisors placed
youth in an illegal restraint. Staff purposely called youth over to a
parking lot, where no cameras would be present to record
anything. Staff then body slammed youth onto the parking lot
ground. Staff also strangled and spit on youth. Youth sustained
bruises (red/purple marks) on her arms.
Youth has been physically assaulted several times by a group of
female residents. Youth has sustained two busted lips, bald spots
in her hair, a swollen finger, bruising on her arms and back. Staff
members have been alerted about the issues. However, staff have
not done much of anything to protect youth or prevent the
constant physical altercations from occurring (Being investigated
in 2025SIC0000158).
2

Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth A reported Supervisor 1 took her teddy bear because he
said she was not listening, so she got mad and told Supervisor 1
she was going to put trash on his car. Youth A stated Supervisor 1
told her he could not wait for her to come next to his car where
there were no cameras. Youth A described approaching
Supervisor 1’s car, seeing Supervisor 1 text someone on his
phone, then picking Youth A up and body slamming her onto the
ground in the staff parking lot. Youth A stated she was up against
a tree and Supervisor 1’s whole body was over her. Youth A
reported Supervisor 1 got off her, shoved her, then spit in Youth
A’s face one time. Youth A described Staff 1 and Staff 2 coming to
assist and Supervisor 1 told Staff 1 and Staff 2 Youth A was
spitting on him. Youth A denied spiting on Supervisor 1. Youth A
stated she was choking on her spit because Supervisor 1’s elbow
was in her throat. Youth A denied having any bruises but stated
she had some marks from being up against the trees.
Youth A reported crying and saying, “he’s [Supervisor 1] hurting
me, he’s hurting me.” Youth A stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 saw
Youth A crying but Supervisor 1 was already off Youth A. Youth A
described Staff 3 arrived to help and Youth A asked Staff 3 to get
the spit off Youth A’s face. Youth A reported she does not feel
safe around Supervisor 1. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 touched
Youth E but Youth A did not see it. Youth A reported she knew
this information because Youth E told Youth A. This is being
investigated in 2025SIC0000205.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth B denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit on
Youth A or any youth. Youth B stated Youth A “swung on”
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 1 placed Youth A in a restraint.
Youth B described Youth A getting out of the restraint and saying
she was “going to fuck up his car.” Youth B reported she did not
see what happened but feels Youth A is trying to get Supervisor 1
in trouble. Youth B reported Youth A was saying, “He chocked me
up, aw, now you fell into my trap.” Youth B stated Youth A said
Supervisor 1 choked her in the woods, in the parking lot and
Youth A’s “story switches up too much.” Youth B reported
Supervisor 1 has never been inappropriate in any restraint Youth
B has observed.
3

Youth C was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth C denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit on
Youth A or any youth. Youth C reported she did not have any
concerns with Supervisor 1 and feels safe around Supervisor 1.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth D denied seeing Supervisor 1 ever slam, choke, or spit on
Youth A or any youth. Youth D reported she has never seen
Supervisor 1 restrain a youth. Youth D described Supervisor 1 as
“a good, respectful guy and chill supervisor.” Youth D stated she
is not scared of any staff and feels safe around staff but not on the
unit because of youth fighting.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth E denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit on
Youth A or any of the girls at the facility.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth F denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit on
Youth A or any youth. Youth F described being restrained multiple
times by Supervisor 1 and not having any concerns with how
Supervisor 1 did the restraint. Youth F reported she has seen
Supervisor 1 restrain other youth and did not have concerns how
the restraints were performed.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 7, 2024. Supervisor 2 could not recall seeing
Supervisor 1 in a restraint or any physical altercation with Youth A.
Supervisor 2 reported he has never seen Supervisor 1 slam,
choke, or spit on a youth. Supervisor 2 denied any youth ever
reporting any concerns regarding Supervisor 1 to him.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024. Staff 5 denied ever seeing Supervisor 1
slam, choke, or spit on Youth A or any youth. Staff 5 reported she
did not have any concerns with Supervisor 1’s interactions with
the youth.
Staff 10 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
10 described Supervisor 1 being “all business, strict and doing his
job.” Staff 10 stated the youth get mad at Supervisor 1 because he
4

holds them accountable and does not allow the youth to get their
way. Staff 10 denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit
on Youth A or any youth. Staff 10 stated she does not have
concerns with any interaction she has witnessed between
Supervisor 1 and youth.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor 1 reported “Youth A has it out for me.” Supervisor 1
stated Youth A was upset because Supervisor 1 took her teddy
bear. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A had been carrying the teddy
bear around acting like it was her baby she had with a male youth.
Supervisor 1 described a few hours later after taking the teddy
bear from Youth A, Staff 3 called Supervisor 1 and said Youth A
was going to put trash on Supervisor 1’s car. Supervisor 1
reported going out the front door of the facility and meeting Youth
A as she came out the back door holding a bag of trash.
Supervisor 1 stated he walked and talked with Youth A attempting
to calm the situation. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A picked up a
rock, threw trash on Supervisor 1’s car and was verbally
threatening Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 described Staff 3 and Staff
9 arriving to assist. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was swinging at
him, so Youth A was placed in a standing restraint by Staff 3 and
himself. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was spitting, throwing her
body back and forth, which made Staff 3 lose her balance, so they
[Supervisor 1, Youth A, and Staff 3] fell to the ground. Supervisor
1 denied Youth A was slammed to the ground. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 9 held Youth A’s feet. Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1
and Staff 2 arrived, and Supervisor 1 was switched out by Staff 2.
Supervisor 1 denied choking or placing his elbow anywhere near
Youth A’s throat. Supervisor 1 denied spitting on Youth A.
Supervisor 1 stated he did not touch Youth A until Staff 3 arrived
and then it was to place Youth A into a restraint.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 6 described
witnessing Supervisor 1 in two or three restraints, not with Youth
A, and not having any concerns with what she witnessed. Staff 6
denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit on Youth A
or any youth. Staff 6 described Supervisor 1 as “real good,
always going by the book.”
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 7 is no longer
employed by the facility. Staff 7 described seeing Supervisor 1
5

restrain Youth A one-time in a standing restraint lasting
approximately five minutes. Staff 7 denied ever seeing Supervisor
1 have his elbow near or by Youth A’s neck or mouth during the
restraint or Supervisor 1 do anything inappropriate during the
restraint. Staff 7 denied seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit
on Youth A or any other youth. Staff 7 described Supervisor 1 as
“lazy and not doing his job.”
Staff 8 was interviewed via telephone on December 20, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 8 reported only
working with Supervisor 1 a short time. Staff 8 stated she has
never observed any concerns with Supervisor 1 around Youth A
or any of the youth.
Staff 9 was interviewed via telephone on December 20, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 9 described Youth A
being upset and saying she was going to put trash on Supervisor
1’s car because he took her teddy bear. Staff 9 stated Youth A
walked out of the cafeteria with trash toward the parking lot. Staff
9 reported she called Supervisor 1 to warn him Youth A had trash
and was headed to his car. Staff 9 stated she went to assist and
when she arrived Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 had Youth A in a
standing restraint. Staff 9 reported the standing restraint was
being done per training and did not have any concerns. Staff 9
described when she arrived at the parking lot Youth A was still on
her feet but was in the process of being transitioned to a supine
and going to the ground. Staff 9 denied Youth A being slammed
to the ground. Staff 9 stated she held Youth A’s legs during the
restraint. Staff 9 denied seeing any spit on Youth A’s face but
stated she did not look for any. Staff 9 reported Staff 2 and Staff 1
came to assist. Staff 9 described Staff 2 switching out Supervisor
1 due to Youth A directing all her anger toward Supervisor 1 and
Staff 1 taking over for Staff 9.
Staff 9 stated she was not looking at Youth A during the restraint,
that her face was faced the opposite way so did not know where
Supervisor 1 was positioned when on the ground. Staff 9 reported
Staff 3 would have been positioned to be able to see how
Supervisor 1 was placed. Staff 9 denied seeing any marks on
Youth A’s neck this day or the day after but stated she did not
complete an exam on Youth A. Staff 9 reported during the supine
restraint Youth A did say she “couldn’t breathe, you’re hurting me,
get off me, I can’t breathe.” Staff 9 stated this is normal for Youth
A to say during a restraint. Staff 9 reported herself, Supervisor 1
and Staff 3 shifted their bodies to make sure their position was
comfortable for Youth A. Staff 9 described being in other restraints
6

with Supervisor 1 and never having concerns with what she has
witnessed. Staff 9 reported Supervisor 1 is stronger, tall and can
get a good hold so the youth cannot manipulate and get out of the
restraint, which the youth do not like.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on December 26, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described Youth A
being upset at Supervisor 1 for taking her teddy bear. Staff 3
reported Youth A grabbed the trash bag from the cafeteria and
headed outside to find Supervisor 1. Staff 3 reported running out
the front door to try and intercept Youth A but when she did Youth
A was already approaching Supervisor 1. Staff 3 stated
Supervisor 1 was walking backwards talking with Youth A, who
was very escalated. Staff 3 described Youth A swinging at
Supervisor 1 so Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 placed Youth A in a
standing restraint. Staff 3 reported as Youth A was being placed in
the standing restraint Youth A fell to the ground. Staff 3 denied
Youth A was slammed to the ground. Staff 3 reported Staff 9
arrived and held Youth A’s feet. Staff 3 described Youth A spitting
on Supervisor 1 and yelling, “you fell into my trap, I’m going to get
you fired.” Staff 3 denied seeing Supervisor 1 spit on Youth A or
see spit on Youth A. Staff 3 stated she did not have any concerns
with how the restraint was done or what Supervisor 1 was doing in
the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on January 15, 2025.
Staff 1 described getting a staff assistance call and responding to
the parking lot at Vassar House. Staff 1 reported Youth A was on
the ground in a restraint with Supervisor 1, Staff 3 and Staff 9.
Staff 1 stated Staff 2 switched out Supervisor 1 and Staff 1
switched out Staff 9. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 walked away
from the situation because Youth A was yelling, swearing, saying
he [Supervisor 1] choked her and continued to be escalated. Staff
1 denied seeing Supervisor choke, spit or have his elbow near or
on Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 stated due to Supervisor 1’s
positioning on the ground there would not be anyway for
Supervisor 1 to choke Youth A. Staff 1 denied seeing any spit on
Youth A. Staff 1 reported he did not see any bruising, marks or
cuts on Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on January 15, 2025.
Staff 4 denied ever seeing Supervisor 1 slam, choke, or spit on
Youth A or any other youth. Staff 4 stated she does not have any
concerns with Supervisor 1. Staff 4 denied any youth ever
reporting to her that Supervisor 1 slammed, choke or spit on them.
7

DHHS Worker does not have findings in the investigation.
Video Reviewed:
There was no video to review as the staff parking lot is not
captured on camera.
Documents Reviewed:
• Agency response plan dated 12/04/24 for Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 1 is not to be alone with any youth at any time
and will not engage in any physical restraint unless he is
the only staff available, then will remove himself as soon as
possible. Plan was signed by Supervisor 1 and Chief
Administrator.
• Supervisor 1 personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record, and Supervisor 1 completed the required CPI
training on 8/14/2024.
• Incident Report 200970239 involving Youth A. The incident
report is consistent with staff interviews. The incident report
is not consistent with Youth A’s interview and how Youth A
described Supervisor 1’s behavior.
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Support and
Management Policy. The policy outlines staff will use non-
violent interventions, and they are to be used in such a
manner as to not be hostile or injurious.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and all youth
interviews, except for Youth A, Supervisor 1 did not slam, choke,
or spit on Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
